javax.microedition.midlet

Class MIDletManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.microedition.midlet.MIDletManager

  • public class MIDletManager
extends java.lang.Object
    MIDletManager is a singleton class responsible for managing the lifecycle of MIDlets. It provides methods to control the auto-launch behavior, notify different states of the MIDlet, and manage application properties.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Retrieves the application property for the given MIDlet and key.

      Returns the current MIDlet being managed.
      static MIDletManager getInstance()
      Returns the singleton instance of MIDletManager.
      boolean isAutoLaunch()
      Checks if auto-launch is enabled for the MIDlet.
      void notifyDestroyed()
      Notifies that the MIDlet has been destroyed.

      Notifies that the application should exit.

      Notifies that the MIDlet has been paused.

      Notifies that the MIDlet has been resumed.

      Sets the auto-launch behavior for the MIDlet.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static final MIDletManager getInstance()
        Returns the singleton instance of MIDletManager.
        Returns:
        the singleton instance of MIDletManager.

      • setAutoLaunch

        public void setAutoLaunch(boolean autoLaunch)
        Sets the auto-launch behavior for the MIDlet.
        Parameters:
        autoLaunch - true to enable auto-launch, false to disable.

      • isAutoLaunch

        public boolean isAutoLaunch()
        Checks if auto-launch is enabled for the MIDlet.
        Returns:
        true if auto-launch is enabled, false otherwise.

      • getAppProperty

        public final java.lang.String getAppProperty(MIDlet midlet,
                                             java.lang.String key)
        Retrieves the application property for the given MIDlet and key.
        Parameters:
        midlet - the MIDlet for which the property is to be retrieved.
        key - the key of the property to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        the value of the property, or null if the property does not exist.

      • notifyDestroyed

        public final void notifyDestroyed()
        Notifies that the MIDlet has been destroyed. Clears the internal state and properties of the MIDletManager.

      • notifyExit

        public final void notifyExit()
        Notifies that the application should exit. Calls the finish method on the CwaActivity instance.

      • notifyPaused

        public final void notifyPaused()
        Notifies that the MIDlet has been paused. Updates the internal state and hides the display canvas.

      • notifyResumed

        public final void notifyResumed()
        Notifies that the MIDlet has been resumed. Updates the internal state and shows the display canvas.

      • getCurrenMIDlet

        public MIDlet getCurrenMIDlet()
        Returns the current MIDlet being managed.
        Returns:
        the current MIDlet, or null if no MIDlet is being managed.

      • setMIDlet

        public void setMIDlet(MIDlet midlet)
        Sets the current MIDlet to be managed.
        Parameters:
        midlet - the MIDlet to be managed.
